title: Metallica is my all time favorite band but I've never seen them live. Do you think they will tour again after the COVID-19 pandemic is over? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know but before I ever saw them live, my parents bought me “Cliff Em All” and it was one of the most important points of my musical experience ever so, my suggestion to you is to grab a copy of “Cliff Em All”, grab your favorite drink and food, turn the lights off, watch it on a nice TV and enjoy yourself. That to me is the closest to feeling - like you were at a real Metallica show because of the bootleg quality interspersed with pro shot footage without crazy, fancy cuts. All of their other live concert videos are great but there’s a magic about Cliff Em All that would make not seeing them live ok. I hope they do play out again though for your and everyone’s sake. Be safe & cheers!

Absolutely. Metallica have always been road dogs. That’s part of the reason they became so huge in their early days. They tour constantly. That mentality has stayed with them, even after the made it big. It’s also how they make their money. They earn, on average, $4 million per show. That’s significantly more that they’d earn from releasing a new album. They love playing for their fans. They’ll hit the road again as soon as they’re able.
